conclusion: Identify the known values: Horizontal distance L = 60 m, Initial velocity v0 = 50 m/s, Launch angle θ = 53°, sin(53°) = 0.8, Gravity g = 10 m/s²

premise: Initial velocity v0 = 50 m/s, Launch angle θ = 53°, sin(53°) = 0.8
conclusion: Determine the horizontal and vertical components of the initial velocity: Horizontal component v0x = v0 cosθ, Vertical component v0y = v0 sinθ
Calculate cos(53°): cos(53°) = sqrt(1 - sin²(53°)) = sqrt(1 - 0.8²) = sqrt(0.36) = 0.6
Calculate horizontal component v0x: v0x = 50 × 0.6 = 30 m/s
Calculate vertical component v0y: v0y = 50 × 0.8 = 40 m/s

premise: Horizontal distance L = 60 m, Horizontal velocity v0x = 30 m/s
conclusion: Calculate the time taken for the projectile to reach the building: t = L / v0x = 60 m / 30 m/s = 2 s

premise: Vertical component v0y = 40 m/s, Time t = 2 s, Gravity g = 10 m/s²
conclusion: Calculate the height H using the vertical motion equation: H = v0y × t - (1/2) × g × t²

premise: v0y = 40 m/s, t = 2 s, g = 10 m/s²
conclusion: Substitute values into the vertical motion equation: H = 40 m/s × 2 s - 5 × 4 m = 80 m - 20 m = 60 m
